list.title: module:kadence/node~ExpirationStream
list.description: Reads objects from a {@link module:kadence/node~ReadableStore} and if an item should be expired, requests deletion.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node
list.description: Kademlia protocol implementation. Creates an interface for orchestrating a Kademlia network and extending it.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#event:message_queued
list.description: RPC message is queued for you to send. This is implementation specific based on how you want to handle networking. This event contains all the data necessary for you to handle transport.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#event:storage_delete
list.description: Indicates that you may delete the item stored by the key. This is triggered most likely by the expiration routine.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#event:storage_expire
list.description: Expiration routine has started. A writable stream is provided. Only items requiring expiration will be requested for deletion.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#event:storage_replicate
list.description: Replication routine has started. A writable stream is provided. Only items requiring replication will be replicated.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#expire
list.description: Items expire T_EXPIRE seconds after the original publication. All items are assigned an expiration time which is "exponentially inversely proportional to the number of nodes between the current node and the node whose ID is closest to the key", where this number is "inferred from the bucket structure of the current node".

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#iterativeFindNode
list.description: Basic kademlia lookup operation that builds a set of K contacts closest to the given key

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#iterativeFindValue
list.description: Kademlia search operation that is conducted as a node lookup and builds a list of K closest contacts. If at any time during the lookup the value is returned, the search is abandoned. If no value is found, the K closest contacts are returned. Upon success, we must store the value at the nearest node seen during the search that did not return the value.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#iterativeStore
list.description: Performs a lookup to collect K contacts nearest to the given key, sending a STORE message to each of them. Note that if there is a protocol/validation error, you will not receive it as a rejection. Be sure to also check that stored > 0 as part of error handling here.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#join
list.description: Inserts the given contact into the routing table and uses it to perform a {@link Node#iterativeFindNode} for this node's identity, then refreshes all buckets further than it's closest neighbor, which will be in the occupied bucket with the lowest index

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#ping
list.description: Sends a PING message to the supplied contact, resolves with latency.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#refresh
list.description: If no node lookups have been performed in any given bucket's range for T_REFRESH, the node selects a random number in that range and does a refresh, an iterativeFindNode using that number as key.

list.title: module:kadence/node~Node#replicate
list.description: Performs a scan of the storage adapter and performs republishing/replication of items stored. Items that we did not publish ourselves get republished every T_REPLICATE. Items we did publish get republished every T_REPUBLISH.

list.title: module:kadence/node~NodeOptions
list.description: Overridable options passed to {@link Node}.

list.title: module:kadence/node~ReadableStore
list.description: Stream consumed by {@link module:kadence/node~ReplicatorStream} and {@link module:kadence/node~ReplicatorStream}.

list.title: module:kadence/node~ReplicatorStream
list.description: Reads objects from a {@link module:kadence/node~ReadableStore} and if an item should be replicated, performs an iterative store operation.

list.title: module:kadence/node~StoredItem
list.description: Format of a storage entry.

list.title: module:kadence/node~knuthShuffle
list.description: Shuffles an array in place.

list.title: module:kadence/node~preventConvoy
list.description: Wraps the supplied function in a pseudo-random length timeout to help prevent convoy effects. These occur when a number of processes need to use a resource in turn. There is a tendency for such bursts of activity to drift towards synchronization, which can be disasterous. In Kademlia all nodes are requird to republish their contents every hour (T_REPLICATE). A convoy effect might lead to this being synchronized across the network, which would appear to users as the network dying every hour. The default timeout will be between 0 and 30 minutes unless specified.

list.title: module:kadence/protocol
list.description: Kademlia RPC handlers and protocol logic.

list.title: module:kadence/protocol~HandlerResponse
list.description: The final argument passed to any protocol handler is a callback function.

list.title: module:kadence/protocol~Protocol#FIND_NODE
list.description: The FIND_NODE RPC includes a 160-bit key. The recipient of the RPC returns up to K contacts that it knows to be closest to the key. The recipient must return K contacts if at all possible. It may only return fewer than K if it is returning all of the contacts that it has knowledge of.

list.title: module:kadence/protocol~Protocol#FIND_VALUE
list.description: A FIND_VALUE RPC includes a B=160-bit key. If a corresponding value is present on the recipient, the associated data is returned. Otherwise the RPC is equivalent to a FIND_NODE and a set of K contacts is returned.

list.title: module:kadence/protocol~Protocol#PING
list.description: This RPC involves one node sending a PING message to another, which presumably replies with a PONG. This has a two-fold effect: the recipient of the PING must update the bucket corresponding to the sender; and, if there is a reply, the sender must update the bucket appropriate to the recipient.

list.title: module:kadence/protocol~Protocol#STORE
list.description: The sender of the STORE RPC provides a key and a block of data and requires that the recipient store the data and make it available for later retrieval by that key.

list.title: module:kadence/protocol~Protocol#events
list.description: Exposes events arising from handling protocol messages. Some of these events may require handling if they pass a {@link Protocol~HandlerResponse}

list.title: module:kadence/router~Router
list.description: Kademlia routing table consisting of {@link module:kadence/constants~B} total {@link module:kadence/bucket~Bucket}s - each holding up to {@link module:kadence/constants~K} total {@link module:kadence/contacts~Contact}s.

list.title: module:kadence/router~Router#addContactByNodeId
list.description: Adds the contact to the routing table in the proper bucket position, returning the [bucketIndex, bucket, contactIndex, contact]; if the returned contactIndex is -1, it indicates the bucket is full and the contact was not added; kademlia implementations should PING the contact at bucket.head to determine if it should be dropped before calling this method again.

list.title: module:kadence/router~Router#event:contact_deleted

list.title: module:kadence/router~Router#events

list.title: module:kadence/router~Router#getContactByNodeId

list.title: module:kadence/router~Router#identity
